## For Undergraduate Students
OMICS Center offers an incredible opportunity for aspiring interns to gain valuable experience and knowledge in the field of OMICS (genomics, transcriptomics,proteomics, and metagenomics, etc.). As an intern at OMICS Center, you will have the chance to work alongside leading researchers and experts, contributing to cutting-edge projects and advancements in the field. This internship program provides a dynamic and immersive learning environment, where you will have access to state-of-the-art technologies and resources. You will engage in hands-on research, data analysis, and collaboration with a diverse team of professionals, fostering your growth and development in the OMICS field. This experience at OMICS Center for Undergraduate Students will undoubtedly be a stepping stone towards a successful career in scientific research and innovation. More information about each admissions cycle can be found on the [News](news.qmd) page.

## For Prospective Collaborators 
OMICS Center warmly welcomes prospective collaborators who are passionate about advancing research and innovation in the field of OMICS (genomics, proteomics, metabolomics, etc.). Collaborating with OMICS Center offers an exceptional opportunity to join a dynamic and interdisciplinary research community. By partnering with us, you will have access to cutting-edge facilities, state-of-the-art technologies, and a diverse network of experts in various fields. We value collaboration and actively seek to foster meaningful partnerships that drive scientific progress and generate impactful outcomes. Whether you are an academic researcher, industry professional, or part of a research institution, collaborating with OMICS Center will enable you to contribute your expertise, exchange ideas, and work together on groundbreaking projects. Together, we can push the boundaries of OMICS research, catalyzing discoveries that have the potential to transform healthcare, agriculture, and various other fields. Join us in this exciting journey of exploration and collaboration at OMICS Center. Please check the [News](news.qmd) page for more information.
